headline: Did Capital One's (COF) $2.75 Billion Debt Issuance Just Shift Its Investment Narrative?
summary: Earlier this month, Capital One Financial completed multiple major fixed-income offerings totaling US$2.75 billion, issuing variable, callable senior unsubordinated unsecured notes due 2031 and 2036, alongside an announced additional offering of similar notes. These large-scale capital raises might signal an evolving approach to liquidity management and funding, which could have significant implications for future asset growth and debt servicing. Next, we'll explore how this substantial debt...

headline: Jim Cramer Says Capital One “Will Make a Fortune Now”

headline: At the Airport, There’s a Fancy New Lounge Everywhere You Look
summary: Airlines and credit-card companies are taking over terminals with ever-swankier amenities, and loyal customers can’t get enough.
